intro: Connarus blanchetii var. blanchetii, commonly known as the African ebony, is a small evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dark, dense wood and glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, followed by small, red berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its valuable timber, it is also of interest in ecological and conservation studies.
